com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin

Class DocumentFileImporter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter

  • public abstract class DocumentFileImporter
extends Object
    An importer reads external files and converts the contents to Geneious documents.

    A plugin may provide a set of DocumentFileImporters via GeneiousPlugin.getDocumentFileImporters().


    There are several good ways to import files from a plugin:

    • If you are making your own custom PluginDocument, it may be desirable to have a constructor that takes a file, and constructs the document from it, e.g. callback.add(new SomethingDocument(file));
    • If you are using an existing document type, the simplest way is usualy to extract the information from the file yourself and create the document from there (see code example below)

    The following is an example of how to construct a DocumentFileImporter using an anonymous inner class. This importer reads files created with the example in DocumentFileExporter. 

        new DocumentFileImporter(){
        public String[] getPermissibleExtensions(){
            return new String[] {".txt"};
        }

        public String getFileTypeDescription(){
            return "sequence txt file";
        }

        //this method returns an DocumentFileImporter.AutoDetectStatus showing whether it can import the file.
        //REJECT_FILE means that the importer will definately not import the file, ACCEPT_FILE means that it definately will, and MAYBE means that we're not sure yet.
        public AutoDetectStatus tentativeAutoDetect(File f, String fileContentsStart){
            //if the beginning of the file contains a character that is not a valid protein character, reject the file
            for(int i=0; i < fileContentsStart.length(); i++){
                char c = fileContentsStart.charAt(i);
                if (AminoAcids.getState(c) == null && c != '\n'){
                    return AutoDetectStatus.REJECT_FILE;
                }
            }
            //otherwise we are unsure.
            return AutoDetectStatus.MAYBE;
        }

        //When importing documents, the documents are added to an DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback
        //instead of the importer returning them in a list or directly adding them to a repository.
        //The callback adds the documents to the local repository while the file is still being read.
        public void importDocuments(File f, ImportCallback callback, ProgressListener progress) throws DocumentImportException, IOException{
            try{
                //First we need to create a reader from the file that Geneious gives us.
                BufferedReader br = new BufferedReader(new FileReader(f));

                //we'll use these two numbers to calculate the progress.
                long fileSize = f.length();
                long count = 0;

                //give the ProgressListener a descriptive message
                progress.setMessage("Importing sequence data");

                //we need to loop through all lines in the file, and create a sequence from each file
                String residues = "";

                //We need to check whether the user has pressed cancel on the ProgressListener, and stop reading the file if they have.
                while((residues = br.readLine()) != null && !progress.isCanceled()){
                    progress.setProgress(((double)count)/fileSize);
                    try{
                        //create a new sequence from the line
                        DefaultAminoAcidSequence seq = new DefaultAminoAcidSequence("New Sequence", "",residues,new Date(f.lastModified()));

                        //increase the count for the ProgressListener
                        count += residues.length();

                        //add the document to the callback
                        callback.addDocument(seq);
                    }
                    catch(IllegalArgumentException ex){
                        //the document was invalid, so we won't add it.
                        //in a more robust implementation we would do something here...
                    }
                }
                //housekeeping...
                br.close();
            }
            catch(FileNotFoundException ex){
                throw new DocumentImportException("File not found: "+ f.getName(),ex);
            }
        }
    }

    • Method Detail

      • getPermissibleExtensions

        public abstract String[] getPermissibleExtensions()
        Standard file name extensions for this document type. This is the first way Geneious tries to match a file to an importer. If multiple importers accept the given file extension, or none of them do, then Geneious will use tentativeAutoDetect(File, String) to try to narrow the candidate list down.
        Returns:
        A list of possible file name extensions, including the dot. E.g. new String[] { ".txt", ".xml" } By default, these extensions are case insensitive, i.e. the filename filter would also allow extensions like ".tXt", ".TXT" etc. If you want case sensitive behaviour, you should override arePermissibleExtensionsCaseSensitive().

      • getFileTypeDescription

        public abstract String getFileTypeDescription()
        Returns:
        The file type description excluding the extension. E.g.: "Text files"

      • tentativeAutoDetect

        public abstract DocumentFileImporter.AutoDetectStatus tentativeAutoDetect(File file,
                                                        String fileContentsStart)
        Attempts to detect whether a file is of the right type for this importer, based purely on the first up to 512 (this number may change in the future) characters of the file. This method should return quickly, and in particular it shouldn't attempt to parse the entire file. In fact, use of the File parameter shouldn't be necessary at all in most cases and is discouraged. Particularly, this method shouldn't check the extension of the file name as it is Geneious core's job to match that, and to make a possible future API easier where we might want to import from resources other than files. Because this method shouldn't scan the whole file, it is permissible in rare cases to return ACCEPT here even if a later import will fail. However this method should never return REJECT if there is a chance that the file might be valid. This method also should not default to MAYBE for each file it cannot rightly return ACCEPT. It would then become the default importer for every file type not recognised by Geneious because it would be the only MAYBE returned for those files.
        Parameters:
        file - to check
        fileContentsStart - first characters (say up to 512 chars) in file.
        Returns:
        Detection status. Cannot be null

      • getOptions

        public Options getOptions(List<File> filesToImport,
                 ProgressListener progressListener)
                   throws DocumentImportException
        Provides some options applicable to this importer to the user. This is guaranteed to be called before any of the importDocuments methods. The user can click "Cancel" at this point and importDocuments(java.io.File, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener) or importDocumentsFromMultipleFilesReturningUnimported(com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.Options, java.util.List<java.io.File>, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener) will not be called The same Options object will be passed to performOperation if the user clicks "Ok". The necessary values can then be extracted from it.
        Parameters:
        filesToImport - files we are importing. This will include all the files being imported, if this importer overrides getPrimaryFileForMultipleFileImporter(java.util.List<java.io.File>), or all the files being imported which will use this importer, if it does not. An importer that provides Options should also handle an empty list of files in order to provide general options which will work on any files
        progressListener - for reporting progress while creating the options and allowing creation to be cancelled.
        Returns:
        Options for configuring this importer or null for none
        Throws:
        DocumentImportException - if the options can't be generated
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • importDocuments

        public abstract void importDocuments(File file,
                   DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback callback,
                   ProgressListener progressListener)
                              throws IOException,
                                     DocumentImportException
        Import document(s) from file into a callback
        Parameters:
        file - to import from.
        callback - use callback.add () for each document imported
        progressListener - call setProgress or similar to report progress for the import. This may be ignored but is not recommended if the import may take more than a second or so.
        Throws:
        IOException - when unable to read the full contents of the file for any reason
        DocumentImportException - when unable to generate document(s) from contents of file.

      • importDocuments

        public void importDocuments(Options options,
                   File file,
                   DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback callback,
                   ProgressListener progressListener)
                     throws IOException,
                            DocumentImportException
        Import document(s) from file into a callback. If an importer returns a non-null value from getOptions(java.util.List, jebl.util.ProgressListener) it should override this to receive the options as input. The default implementation calls importDocuments(java.io.File, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener).
        Parameters:
        file - to import from.
        options - options to use for import (from getOptions(java.util.List, jebl.util.ProgressListener) or null for no options
        callback - use callback.add () for each document imported
        progressListener - call setProgress or similar to report progress for the import. This may be ignored but is not recommended if the import may take more than a second or so.
        Throws:
        IOException - when unable to read the full contents of the file for any reason
        DocumentImportException - when unable to generate document(s) from contents of file.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • getPrimaryFileForMultipleFileImporter

        public File getPrimaryFileForMultipleFileImporter(List<File> files)
        Determines if this importer supports importing from a list of multiple files. It is only necesary to implement this if the importer actually looks at all the files simultaneously when creating documents. e.g. The .qual file format requires an associated .fasta file to generate its sequences.

        The default implementation returns null. An implementation that returns a non-null value must also implement importDocumentsFromMultipleFilesReturningUnimported(Options options, java.util.List, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener)}.

        Parameters:
        files - all the files to be imported.
        Returns:
        if this importer can import all these files as a group then it returns the primary file from the group, which is used for naming any sequence list documents generated as a result of the import. Or null if this importer is not able to import all of these files.

      • importDocumentsFromMultipleFiles

        public void importDocumentsFromMultipleFiles(List<File> filesToImport,
                                    DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback callback,
                                    ProgressListener progressListener)
                                      throws IOException,
                                             DocumentImportException
        Deprecated. use importDocumentsFromMultipleFilesReturningUnimported(Options, java.util.List, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener) instead
        An alternative to importDocuments(java.io.File, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener) that importers which import multiple files may implement. An implementation must also implement getPrimaryFileForMultipleFileImporter(java.util.List).

        The default implementation of this method throws an UnsupportedOperationException

        Parameters:
        filesToImport - the files to import
        callback - use callback.add () for each document imported
        progressListener - call setProgress or similar to report progress for the import. This may be ignored but is not recommended if the import may take more than a second or so.
        Throws:
        IOException - when unable to read the full contents of the files for any reason
        DocumentImportException - when unable to generate document(s) from contents of files.

      • importDocumentsFromMultipleFilesReturningUnimported

        public List<File> importDocumentsFromMultipleFilesReturningUnimported(Options options,
                                                             List<File> filesToImport,
                                                             DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback callback,
                                                             ProgressListener progressListener)
                                                               throws IOException,
                                                                      DocumentImportException
        An alternative to importDocuments(java.io.File, com.biomatters.geneious.publicapi.plugin.DocumentFileImporter.ImportCallback, jebl.util.ProgressListener) that importers which import multiple files may implement. An implementation must also implement getPrimaryFileForMultipleFileImporter(java.util.List).

        The default implementation of this method throws an UnsupportedOperationException

        Parameters:
        options - options to use for import from getOptions(java.util.List, jebl.util.ProgressListener). If null is passed in the importer must proceed with reasonable default settings. The default implementation of this method does not pass on the options.
        filesToImport - the files to import
        callback - use callback.add () for each document imported
        progressListener - call setProgress or similar to report progress for the import. This may be ignored but is not recommended if the import may take more than a second or so.
        Returns:
        any files that were not imported
        Throws:
        IOException - when unable to read the full contents of the files for any reason
        DocumentImportException - when unable to generate document(s) from contents of files.
        Since:
        API 4.50 (Geneious 5.5.0)

      • arePermissibleExtensionsCaseSensitive

        public boolean arePermissibleExtensionsCaseSensitive()
        Specifies whether the extensions returned by getPermissibleExtensions() should be regarded case sensitive.
        Returns:
        true if extensions returned by getPermissibleExtensions() are case sensitive, i.e. an extension of e.g. ".pdf" in the list does not match ".PDF", ".pDf" documents. false otherwise (default).

      • isProOnly

        @Deprecated
public boolean isProOnly()
        Deprecated. Importers and exporters should not be restricted, all though this method still functions.
        This function returns true if the importer requires an active license
        Returns:
        true if the importer requires an active license

      • getUniqueId

        public String getUniqueId()
        Get a unique identifier for this DocumentFileImporter. This is so that PluginUtilities.getDocumentFileImporter(String) can be used to find this DocumentFileImporter. A unique identifier may consist of any valid Java indentifier characters (see Character.isJavaIdentifierPart(char) as well as to the space character.
        Returns:
        a unique identifier for this DocumentFileImporter. The default implementation returns the className.

      • getFractionOfTimeToSaveResults

        public double getFractionOfTimeToSaveResults()
        Returns an approximate fraction of the total operation time which will probably be required to save the imported document(s).

        The default implementation returns 0.5 which means that the progress returned from importDocuments and related methods will take the progress bar up to 50% and then Geneious will fill in the remaining 50% as the documents is saved to the user's local database.

        Returns:
        an approximate fraction of the total operation time which will probably be required to save the generated document(s).
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)

      • supportsCompression

        public boolean supportsCompression(CompressionUtilities.CompressionMethod method)
        Returns true if this DocumentFileImporter is able to handle a specified type of compression. See CompressionUtilities. If an importer returns false then Geneious will decompress the file before passing it to the importer.

        A DocumentFileImporter should return true if it wishes to handle the compressed file itself. For example if files are typically large and the importer makes use of streams to avoid using the extra disk space required to decompress the file.

        Note: If an importer returns true then it may find methods in CompressionUtilities helpful.

        Parameters:
        method - The compression method
        Returns:
        true if this DocumentFileImporter supports importing files compressed with the specified compression method
        Since:
        API 4.600 (Geneious 6.0.0)
